author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
Phil, your advice is sound but it wouldn’t have stopped these poor souls being infected with this NEW illness for which vaccinations are yet to be developed. Were you wearing a full bio-hazard suit on your travels or were you just lucky?
Passengers are now confined to cabins like prisoners, those having inboard cabins being allowed a few minutes on deck each day.

author: Phil
content:
Idiot people who don’t get proper education AND vaccinations BEFORE traveling abroad! You can’t drink the water, trust the ice and don’t even attempt to eat from shady street vendors or places with few locals.

I traveled to 18+ countries, S. Africa, Angola Africa, Nicaragua, Mexico, Indonesia, Japan, Afghanistan, Azerbaijan, UK, Paris a etc. and never once got sick!

Example: Cured (?) Pork leg sitting out, flys all around and the tourist ate slices. Why?

And drinking glasses may look clean, don’t trust them.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
At some point the cruise industry bubble is going to burst as there is unsustainable growth due to corporate greed. I was expecting the tipping point to be due to a stock markets crash and financial downturn or even just cruising going out of fashion but we now have a new possible cause.
I wont be sorry, trying to pick out the navigation lights of cruise ships is nearly impossible because of all their other lights.
